history.content:
Computer Science Mentors (CSM) is a student-run organization that provides guidance and resources in a smaller classroom environment through group tutoring sessions. Each section has 4-7 students and focuses on material from one of the following courses: CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, CS 88, EECS 16A, or EECS 16B. The goal of CSM is to build a personal learning community and social network so that both students and mentors can comfortably seek and receive help.

 

For Fall 2022, we're recruiting for the following roles:

  • Junior Mentors (JMs) for CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, CS 88C, EECS 16A, and EECS 16B

  • Associate Mentors (AMs) for CS 61A, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, CS 88C, EECS 16A, and EECS 16B

  • Content Mentors (CMs) for CS 61A, CS 61B, and CS 61C

 

The application is available at https://tinyurl.com/csm-fa22-application and is due Friday August 12th at 11:59PM PST. No late applications will be accepted! 

 

Visit https://csmentors.berkeley.edu for more information or get in touch with us at mentors@berkeley.edu!
